intro: Laserpitium nestleri var. obtusatum, commonly known as the obtuse leafed snowbell, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Andes in South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant is distinguished by its lanceolate, obtuse leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
